posts.content: Hi everyone, I'm confused about Question 8 in GA5. The question asks about using GPT models but the AI proxy only supports gpt-4o-mini. Should I use that or stick to the specified model?
posts.author: student_user1

posts.content: I have the same question! The assignment specifically mentions gpt-3.5-turbo-0125 but the proxy doesn't have it.
posts.author: student_user2

posts.content: My understanding is that you just have to use a tokenizer, similar to what Prof. Anand used, to get the number of tokens and multiply that by the given rate.
posts.author: ta_helper1

posts.content: Use the model that's mentioned in the question. You must use gpt-3.5-turbo-0125, even if the AI Proxy only supports gpt-4o-mini. Use the OpenAI API directly for this question.
posts.author: prof_anand

posts.content: I'm having trouble with the data cleaning assignment. There are missing values in multiple columns and I'm not sure which imputation method to use.
posts.author: student_user3

posts.content: For numerical columns, try median imputation first. For categorical, use mode. But check the missingness pattern first.
posts.author: ta_helper2

posts.content: Remember to document why you chose each method. The choice depends on whether the data is MCAR, MAR, or MNAR.
posts.author: ta_helper1

posts.content: What are the key principles for creating effective data visualizations in our assignments?
posts.author: student_user4

posts.content: Focus on clarity and purpose. Choose the right chart type, use clear labels, and avoid unnecessary decorations. Prof. Anand emphasized this in Week 4 lectures.
posts.author: ta_helper2

posts.content: For the ML assignment, how do I choose between different algorithms? Should I try all of them?
posts.author: student_user5

posts.content: Start with simple models like linear/logistic regression as baselines. Then try more complex ones. Use cross-validation to compare performance objectively.
posts.author: ta_helper1

posts.content: Don't forget to consider interpretability vs. performance trade-offs. Document your model selection process.
posts.author: prof_anand

posts.content: I'm getting memory errors when running PySpark on large datasets. Any configuration tips?
posts.author: student_user6

posts.content: Try increasing driver and executor memory. Also consider partitioning your data appropriately. Use spark.sql.adaptive.enabled=true for better resource utilization.
posts.author: ta_helper2
